data.title: CRRL Picks: Discovering Ukraine - Central Rappahannock Regional Library
data.meta_description: CRRL Picks: Discovering Ukraine by CRRL_VirginiaJ - a staff-created list : Understanding Ukraine's history and cultures gives us a more informed way to connect to today's events. The materials on this list are from different age-level collections and are noted as such.
data.text:
The author spent 10 years traveling and reporting in Ukraine and Russia. She introduces individuals whose personal stories illuminate the social and political struggles in the region. From the adult collection. The author spent 10 years traveling and reporting in Ukraine and Russia. She introduces individuals whose personal stories illuminate the social and political struggles in the region. From the adult collection. Show less

This novel for middle grades tells of an at-times difficult friendship between two girls forged in the tragedy of Chernobyl's aftermath, which has fractured both their families. From the children's collection. This novel for middle grades tells of an at-times difficult friendship between two girls forged in the tragedy of Chernobyl's aftermath, which has fractured both their families. From the children's collection. Show less

The recent Oscar-nominated mini series from HBO dramatizes what happened to the community and in the political realm in the aftermath of the disaster. From our adult video collection. The recent Oscar-nominated mini series from HBO dramatizes what happened to the community and in the political realm in the aftermath of the disaster. From our adult video collection. Show less

The nuclear power disaster at Chernobyl in Ukraine was unlike any other experienced and had repercussions throughout the world. At the time that it happened, Ukraine was part of the Soviet Union. From the young adult collection. The nuclear power disaster at Chernobyl in Ukraine was unlike any other experienced and had repercussions throughout the world. At the time that it happened, Ukraine was part of the Soviet Union. From the young adult collection. Show less

The beloved musical about a milkman and his daughters is set in a fictional Ukrainian Jewish village during a period when Imperial Russia controlled the region. From Kanopy's adult collection. Also available on DVD. The beloved musical about a milkman and his daughters is set in a fictional Ukrainian Jewish village during a period when Imperial Russia controlled the region. From Kanopy's adult collection. Also available on DVD. Show less

The segment on Ukraine gives a look at how matters stood during the unrest in early 2014, which also involved tensions between the U.S. and Russia. From Kanopy's adult collection and part of PBS' Frontline series. The segment on Ukraine gives a look at how matters stood during the unrest in early 2014, which also involved tensions between the U.S. and Russia. From Kanopy's adult collection and part of PBS' Frontline series. Show less

Written by the director of Harvard's Ukrainian Research Institute, this volume reaches into the past to make sense of the present and has been recently up...Show more Written by the director of Harvard's Ukrainian Research Institute, this volume reaches into the past to make sense of the present and has been recently updated. It is Amazon's #1 bestseller for the topic of History of Russia & Former Soviet Republics. From the adult collection. Show less

A Ukrainian-born star of the popular television series shares his life story so far, including his childhood both in Odessa and as an immigrant in America, alongside his brother and fellow dancer/choreographer Maksim. From our adult collection. A Ukrainian-born star of the popular television series shares his life story so far, including his childhood both in Odessa and as an immigrant in America, alongside his brother and fellow dancer/choreographer Maksim. From our adult collection. Show less

A look at the motivations behind Putin's 2014 invasion of Crimea and the attempts and consequences of the U.S.' and its allies' strict sanctions and efforts to isolate Russia diplomatically. From our adult collection. A look at the motivations behind Putin's 2014 invasion of Crimea and the attempts and consequences of the U.S.' and its allies' strict sanctions and efforts to isolate Russia diplomatically. From our adult collection. Show less

A recent history of the troubles in Ukraine as written by a gifted war correspondent who spoke with pensioners and poets as well as soldiers and politicians. From our adult collection. A recent history of the troubles in Ukraine as written by a gifted war correspondent who spoke with pensioners and poets as well as soldiers and politicians. From our adult collection. Show less

Chernobyl is back in the news, and this brilliantly written account of the 1986 disaster includes personal stories, a clear, detailed account of what went...Show more Chernobyl is back in the news, and this brilliantly written account of the 1986 disaster includes personal stories, a clear, detailed account of what went on in the reactor itself, and a look at how the Soviet regime responded to the emergency. From our adult collection. Show less

Folktales are an important part of how culture is shared with children. We own several editions of this sweet story of woodland animals working to make th...Show more Folktales are an important part of how culture is shared with children. We own several editions of this sweet story of woodland animals working to make the most of a lost mitten. Jan Brett's version of the Ukranian folktale is quite appealing. From our children's picture book collection. Show less

A short (15-minute) recounting of the February 2014 protests in Kiev's main square by participants and observers. The interviews with citizens are subtitled from Ukrainian and Russian. This film was a Cannes selection. From Kanopy's adult collection. A short (15-minute) recounting of the February 2014 protests in Kiev's main square by participants and observers. The interviews with citizens are subtitled from Ukrainian and Russian. This film was a Cannes selection. From Kanopy's adult collection. Show less

Ukraine was considered the jewel in the Nazi empire and as such was destined to be a German colony administered by the likes of the SS. Part of that colon...Show more Ukraine was considered the jewel in the Nazi empire and as such was destined to be a German colony administered by the likes of the SS. Part of that colonial vision entailed murdering Jews, enslaving Ukrainians, and putting the local ethnic Germans in charge. This localized account is based on German wartime records, diaries, personal interviews, and memoirs. From our adult collection. Show less

Stalin's agricultural collectivization in 1929 forced peasants off their lands and brought about a very lethal famine, killing an estimated five million p...Show more Stalin's agricultural collectivization in 1929 forced peasants off their lands and brought about a very lethal famine, killing an estimated five million people between 1931 and 1933. The author argues that more than 3 million of those were Ukrainians, who were not accidental victims but political targets. A somber yet readable history from our adult collection. Show less

This follow-up to Oliver Stone's Ukraine on Fire continues the story of the embattled country in the wake of events in the 2010s. From our adult Kanopy collection. Running time: 90 minutes. This follow-up to Oliver Stone's Ukraine on Fire continues the story of the embattled country in the wake of events in the 2010s. From our adult Kanopy collection. Running time: 90 minutes. Show less

Sometimes history is more relatable as a novel. New mom (and struggling actress) Natasha finds strength from her grandmother's story of the family's escape from the Nazi regime in Kiev. From our adult fiction collection. Sometimes history is more relatable as a novel. New mom (and struggling actress) Natasha finds strength from her grandmother's story of the family's escape from the Nazi regime in Kiev. From our adult fiction collection. Show less

In this graphic novel memoir, author Julia Alekseyeva tells her own story and the story of her great-grandmother Lola, born to a poor Jewish family outsid...Show more In this graphic novel memoir, author Julia Alekseyeva tells her own story and the story of her great-grandmother Lola, born to a poor Jewish family outside of Kiev in 1910. Lola survived the Bolshevik revolution, civil war, Stalinist purges, and the Holocaust, eventually working as a secretary for the NKVD (later the KGB) and a lieutenant in the Red Army before becoming a refugee in the United States. From our young adult collection. Show less

Tolya is half Ukrainian and half Polish. When Soviet soldiers liberate his Polish city from the Nazis, he joins the Red Army just to have something to eat...Show more Tolya is half Ukrainian and half Polish. When Soviet soldiers liberate his Polish city from the Nazis, he joins the Red Army just to have something to eat and to stay alive. Then he not-quite-accidentally shoots his unit's political officer and falls in with a squad of Ukrainian freedom fighters. In a city with such shifting loyalties, who is the traitor? From our young adult collection. Show less

All copies in use Availability details

A book that tells about the country for upper elementary and middle grades. From our children's non-fiction collection. A book that tells about the country for upper elementary and middle grades. From our children's non-fiction collection. Show less

A professor of history and Slavic studies at the University of Victoria gives his succinct breakdown of Ukrainian history, cultures, and politics. From our adult collection. A professor of history and Slavic studies at the University of Victoria gives his succinct breakdown of Ukrainian history, cultures, and politics. From our adult collection. Show less

In the aftermath of the events of early 2014, three journalists went to three different places across the country to see what was happening and what might develop. From our adult Kanopy collection. Running time: 51 minutes. In the aftermath of the events of early 2014, three journalists went to three different places across the country to see what was happening and what might develop. From our adult Kanopy collection. Running time: 51 minutes. Show less
